solution_line_template: The hairstylist earns ${normal_haircut_price} x {num_normal_haircuts_per_day} = $<<{normal_haircut_price}*{num_normal_haircuts_per_day}={normal_earnings_per_day}>>{normal_earnings_per_day} for a normal haircut per day.

He earns ${special_haircut_price} x {num_special_haircuts_per_day} = $<<{special_haircut_price}*{num_special_haircuts_per_day}={special_earnings_per_day}>>{special_earnings_per_day} for a special haircut.

And he earns ${trendy_haircut_price} x {num_trendy_haircuts_per_day} = $<<{trendy_haircut_price}*{num_trendy_haircuts_per_day}={trendy_earnings_per_day}>>{trendy_earnings_per_day} for a trendy haircut.

So, the total amount he earns per day is ${normal_earnings_per_day} + ${special_earnings_per_day} + ${trendy_earnings_per_day} = $<<{normal_earnings_per_day}+{special_earnings_per_day}+{trendy_earnings_per_day}={total_earnings_per_day}>>{total_earnings_per_day}.
Therefore, a hairstylist earns ${total_earnings_per_day} x {days_in_week}= $<<{total_earnings_per_day}*{days_in_week}={earnings_per_week}>>{earnings_per_week} per month.
